column2: CA GOP Suggests 5G Trackers In Vaccines: Hilarity Ensues
column5: Open ridicule is the only way.  Orange County Republican Don Wagner decided to bring up "5G trackers in vaccines" at an official meeting with Dr. Clayton Chau director of the Orange County Health Care Agency who happens to be the county's chief public health officer. Seriously this Republican is an elected official.  Republican Orange County voters are to blame for this person being in office to ask questions like this:  "We heard about an injection of a tracking device.  Is that being done anywhere in Orange County?" Dr. Chau should not have apologized for LAUGHING.  But he did.  "I'm sorry I just have to compose myself" Chau said.  "There is not a vaccine with a tracking device embedded in it that I know of ...in the world period." Don Wagner is also a total hypocrite. He got his shot three weeks ago. pic.twitter.com/1Zr1R4Q6Rn â€” Alexandre Martins (@alexmartins) April 28 2021 But hey maybe we OUGHT to "track" him for blatant pandering and idiocy.
